intro: Selago trichophylla, commonly known as the hairy leaf selago, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Selago trichophylla is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
